Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event fail_dma on mariner module for 2-3 seconds on all the instances.
Expected Behaviour: Not implemented yet

Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event  iob_empty on mariner module on all the instances.
Expected Behaviour: If reset is done whithin the max_latency then fio should continue, otherwise fio should fail
Notes / Detailed Description:
- Simulate event on target.
- Need to set and reset event
- use max_latency parameter in fio command

Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event bufpool_empty on mariner module  on all the instances.
Expected Behaviour: If reset is done whithin the max_latency then fio should continue, otherwise fio should fail
Notes / Detailed Description:
- Simulate event on target.
- Need to set and reset event
- use max_latency parameter in fio command

Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event abort_before_io on mariner module [Not on each instance].
Expected Behaviour: IOs should not fail. Please wait until first abort comes from host (check /var/log/messages of fw)
Notes / Detailed Description:
- Simulate event on  initiator.
- No need to reset event. It gets reset after first abort comes from host.

Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event plex_ioerror on mariner module on all the instances.
Expected Behaviour:
A single IO on each mariner will fail. Should try with DD command also.
Should see message at embedded "mariner_childdone:545] child command (opcode 0x2 obj_type 4) completed with cmd status: 0x0, completion status: 0x6"
Notes / Detailed Description:
- Simulate event on  initiator.
- No need to reset event. It gets reset automatically after failing first IO on each mariner.

Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event volume_fail on mariner on all the instances.
Expected Behaviour: IOs will fail until event is reset. FW log will show Io errors with volume is in state 5. After event reset, run fio and it should work.
Notes / Detailed Description:
- Simulate event on initiator.
- Need to set and reset event
Volume state is shown as 7 in Fw logs:-
Apr  1 06:07:48 captain user.err mariner: [pid: 1172] 06:07:48.282810 [volio_start:668] Received command (1-1) on volume: 0 in state 7

Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event  io_timeout on mariner module on all the instances.
Expected Behaviour: Fw log shows msg like "Simulating IO Timeout for CTX". Single IO done will be timedout and host sends Abort for it. fio should continue working.
Notes / Detailed Description:
- Simulate event on  initiator.
- No need to reset event. It gets reset automatically after timingout first IO on each mariner

Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event abort_timeout on mariner module   on all the instances.
Expected Behaviour:
This set should be after setting io_timeout event. Not only IO will timeout, its Abort will also timeout and nvme driver may send LUN reset command. IOs will fail. Do IOs again, then IOs should not fail.
 
Should see following similar messages in dmesg

[ 2024.045627] nvme nvme1: I/O 32 QID 1 timeout, aborting
[ 2054.061599] nvme nvme1: I/O 32 QID 1 timeout, reset controller
[ 2054.170812] nvme nvme1: Abort status: 0x7
[ 2054.170867] nvme 0000:05:10.3: enabling device (0140 -> 0142)
[ 2054.170871] nvme nvme1: completing aborted command with status: fffffffc
[ 2054.170877] blk_update_request: I/O error, dev nvme1n1, sector 42009536
Notes / Detailed Description:
- Simulate event on  initiator.
- No need to reset event. It gets reset automatically after timingout first Abort command on each mariner
1. Set event io_timeout.
2. Set event abort_timeout.
3. sudo /usr/local/bin/fio --ioengine=libaio --direct=0 --number_ios=1 --thread=1 --numjobs=1 --iodepth=1 --bs=4K --rw=write --name=dev1 --filename=/dev/nvme1n1

Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event skip_readdma on mariner module for 2-3 seconds on all the instances.
Expected Behaviour: IOs will timeout until event is reset and their aborts will come. fio should fail eventually. After event reset, run fio and it should work.
Notes / Detailed Description:
- Simulate event on  initiator.
- Need to reset the event

Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event drive_qfull on ldfs module for [2-3 seconds & 50 seconds]on all the instances.
Expected Behaviour: IOs should not fail. But if this event is left set for long time, eventually FW may stop accepting IOs from host.
Notes / Detailed Description:
- Simulate event on target.
- Need to reset the event.

Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event cmd_full on ldfs module for 2-3 seconds on all the instances.
Expected Behaviour: IOs should not fail. But if this event is left set for long time, eventually FW may stop accepting IOs from host.
Notes / Detailed Description:
- Simulate event on target.
- Need to reset the event.

Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event  driveio_hang on ldfs module on all the instances.
Expected Behaviour:
IOs should not fail. Aborts may be issed by host. After first Abort from host, the event will be reset automatically.
Plex should detach.
Notes / Detailed Description:
- Simulate event on target.
- No Need to reset the event.

Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event  driveio_hang_done on ldfs module on all the instances.
Expected Behaviour: This will be done by earlier event after abort comes. So I don't think it should be tried separately.

Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event  low_l1_cache on ldfs module for 2-3 seconds.
Expected Behaviour: Today this will crash firmware as this error case is not handled properly. 4907 exist for this. After 4907 is fixed, IOs should not fail. If event is left set for long time, aborts will come.
Notes / Detailed Description:
- Simulate event on target.
- Need to reset the event.

Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event mdio_fail on ldfs module for 2-3 seconds on all the instances.
Expected Behaviour: IOs should not fail.
Notes / Detailed Description:
- Simulate event on target.
- Event gets resetted after first IO retry

Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event fail_dma on iom module on all the instances.
Expected Behaviour: (Not implemented in firmware yet)

Description: While IOs are happening on volume, simulate event abort_deferred on iom module on all the instances.
Expected Behaviour: Once abort comes for an IO, further IOs will work fine. fio should not fail.

Description: No Events supported for module: cmpl
Simulate event scd_crash_vol_create_1 on scd module. Create volume.
Expected Behaviour:
1. Simulate event   (simutil -s -m scd -e <event>)
2. Create volume.   (must be in Scheduled state. Node must go in not ready state. scd core must get generated)
3. Reboot node.
4. After reboot volume must be in Available state

Description: Simulate event scd_crash_vol_create_2 on scd module.  Create volume
Expected Behaviour:
1. Simulate event   (simutil -s -m scd -e <event>)
2. Create volume.   (must be in Scheduled state. Node must go in not ready state. scd core must get generated)
3. Reboot node.
4. After reboot volume must be in Available state

Description: Simulate event scd_crash_vol_create_3 on scd module.  Create volume.
Expected Behaviour:
1. Simulate event   (simutil -s -m scd -e <event>)
2. Create volume.   (must be in Scheduled state. Node must go in not ready state. scd core must get generated)
3. Reboot node.
4. After reboot volume must be in Available state

Description: Simulate event scd_crash_vol_create_4 on scd module. Create volume.
Simulate event scd_crash_vol_create_5 on scd module.  Create volume.
Simulate event scd_crash_vol_create_6 on scd module.  Create volume.
Ceate volume. Simulate event scd_crash_vol_delete_1 on scd module. Delete volume.
Expected Behaviour:
0. Create a volume.
1. Simulate event   (simutil -s -m scd -e <event>)
2. delete volume.   (Volume must remain in pendingdelete state. Scd cor must get created. Node must be in notready state)
3. Reboot node.
4. After reboot volume must be deleted.

Description: Create volume. Simulate event scd_crash_vol_delete_2 on scd module. Delete volume.
Expected Behaviour:
0. Create a volume.
1. Simulate event   (simutil -s -m scd -e <event>)
2. delete volume.   (Volume must remain in pendingdelete state. Scd cor must get created. Node must be in notready state)
3. Reboot node.
4. After reboot volume must be deleted.

Description: Create volume. Simulate event scd_crash_vol_delete_3 on scd module. Delete volume.
Expected Behaviour:
0. Create a volume.
1. Simulate event   (simutil -s -m scd -e <event>)
2. delete volume.   (Volume must remain in pendingdelete state. Scd cor must get created. Node must be in notready state)
3. Reboot node.
4. After reboot volume must be deleted.

Scenario: Simulate events on btp module. (Applicable only for remote/mirrored volume)
Description:
simulate event drop_data_pkt on btp module.
1. Set event on target
2. Do single read IO
Expected Behaviour:
Observations:
On Initiator (embedded logs):-
1. Received abort command for ctrl
2. Sending exchange cleanup frame to BTP 
3. Sending exchange cleanup frame to target
4. Received exchange cleanup response 
5. Got cmpl for abort
On target (embedded logs):-
1. Eleven info logs as, "Simulating IO Error: Drop data packet"
2. Giving up on packet 
3. Sending RS_EXCH_CTRL_ERR for ctrl
4. Sending exchange cleanup frame to BTP
5. Sending exchange cleanup from to target

Scenario: Simulate events on btp module. (Applicable only for remote/mirrored volume)
Description:
simulate event  drop_read_cmd on btp module.
1. Set event on target
2. Do single read IO
Expected Behaviour:
Observations:
On Initiator (embedded logs):-
1. Giving up on packet after max retries
2. Sending RS_EXCH_CTRL_ERR
3. Received abort command for ctrl
4. Sending exchange cleanup frame to BTP
5. Sending exchange cleanup frame to target
6. Received exchange cleanup responce
7. Got cmpl for abort
On target (embedded logs):- 
1. Eleven info logs as "Simulating IO Error: Drop READ_CMD
2. Sending exchange cleanup frame to BTP
3. Sending exchange cleanup response

Scenario: Simulate events on btp module. (Applicable only for remote/mirrored volume)
Description:
simulate event  drop_write_cmd on btp module.
1. Set event on target. 
2. Do single write IO.
Expected Behaviour:
Observations: 
On Initiator (embedded logs):- 
1. Giving up on packet after max retries. 
2. Sending RS_EXCH_CTRL_ERR 
3. Received abort command 
4. Sending exchange cleanup frame to BTP 
5. Sending exchange cleanup frame target 
6. Received exchange cleanup response 
7. Failed IO on ctrl 
8. Got cmpl for abort. 
On target (embedded logs):- 
1. Eleven info logs as, "Simulating IO Error: Drop WRITE_CMD" 
2. Sending exchnage cleanup frame to BTP 
3. Sending exchange cleanup response.

Description: Simulate event drop_identify on ach module.
Expected Behaviour:
1. After setting event, send nvme id-ctrl command to an attached volume's nvme device and its ns (nvme1, nvme1n1 both), which should fail.
2. Set event and attach volume. nvme device may not be seen after attach or IOs may fail on it.
Notes / Detailed Description: Need to be resetted. Simulate event on initiator.

Description: Create 3-way mirrored volumes. Simulate Transient drive error (io fail) on Initiator node. IOs should continue (i.e. no io errors). After transient-error is reset, wait for plexes to get resync. Then compare data across all plexes which must be same.
Expected Behaviour: Create a mirrored volume, Do write IOs, start read ios, simulate plexio_error on inititator, should not get any io errors. read will be done from remote plex, after simulating io error.

Description: Create 3-way mirrored volumes. Simulate Transient drive error (io fail) on Initiator node. IOs should continue (i.e. no io errors). After transient-error is reset, wait for plexes to get resync. Then compare data across all plexes which must be same.
Expected Behaviour: Create a mirrored volume, start write IOs, during IOs, simulate IO error. on initiator. local plex should get detached. Should not get any IO errors. Let IO complete. Attach detached plex. Let resync happen. Verify data on all plexes.

Description: Create 3-way mirrored volumes. Simulate Transient drive error (io fail) on any target node. IOs should continue (i.e. no io errors). The affected plex should go to detached/need-resync state. After transient-error is reset, wait for plexes to get resync. Then compare data across all plexes which must be same.
Expected Behaviour: Sceanrio 1: Create a mirrrored volume, Do write IOs, set remote plex as preferred plex, start read ios, simulate plexio_error on target (having preferred plex), should not get any io errors.

Description: Create 3-way mirrored volumes. Simulate Transient drive error (io fail) on any target node. IOs should continue (i.e. no io errors). The affected plex should go to detached/need-resync state. After transient-error is reset, wait for plexes to get resync. Then compare data across all plexes which must be same.
Expected Behaviour: Scenario 2: Create a mirrored volume, start write IOs, during IOs, simulate IO error (driveio_hang, ldfs module). on target node. Remote plex should get detached. Should not get any IO errors. Let IO complete. Attach detached plex. Let resync happen. Verify data on all plexes.

Description: Create 3-way mirrored volumes. Simulate bad drive error (permanent failure) on the Initiator node. IOs should continue (i.e. no io errors). After new drive is inserted on Initiator node, create new plex, attach it to the volume, wait for the plex to get resync. Then compare data across all plexes which must be same.
Expected Behaviour: Need way to simulate bad drive error.

Description: Create 3-way mirrored volumes. Simulate bad drive error (permanent failure) on any Target node. IOs should continue (i.e. no io errors). Affected plex should go to detached/need-resync state. After new drive is inserted on target node, create new plex, attach it to the volume, wait for the plex to get resync. Then compare data across all plexes which must be same.
Expected Behaviour: Need way to simulate bad drive error.
